intro: Ectrosia laxa, commonly known as the slender glassworts, is a flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. Ectrosia laxa is native to southern Africa and thrives in coastal areas with saline soils. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh, coastal conditions.
